intro: Luetzelburgia guaissara, commonly known as the Guajira luetzelburgia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in coastal and sandy environments, often found in the Guajira Peninsula of Venezuela and Colombia. Luetzelburgia guaissara is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
